title: @Riot Will The Assassin Update Include New Items?
body: I remember hearing when {{item:3147}} was announced that you guys wanted to make more "Assassin focused" items rather than general AD items. Is this going to be done in this class update?

replies.body: Current plan is for some work on items for assassins. That hasn't been started yet though, so not sure whether that will mean new items or just changes to existing ones.
maybe even an ap assassin item?

Possible, but less likely. AP assassins are both a smaller group and one that's comparatively well served by existing itemization given the similarities between burst mage needs and AP assassin needs.

I believe AP Assassins may need better ways of acquiring  flat magic pen, considering the only ways are:

1.  Sorcerer's Shoes- Limiting AP Assassins to building just them.
2. Abyssal Scepter- Giving the most pen (or resist reduce) of any item, but only truly (or efficiently) usable if magic resist is needed. And depending by the Assassin's play-style, or skill at timing and finding openings it may not be needed.
3. Haunting Guise- Liandri's Torment- Not quite a good passive for an Assassin most of the times.

This is especially true for Katarina, as unlike the other Assassins, she has low scalings, and requires magic pen to be effective.

I thought about some magic pen and ap specifically for ap assassins in addition to Sorcerer's Shoes, (Liandrys is only very good on mages) plus a good passive, but without making it broken on immobile mages (with a trade-off for them?)

Why not do the same thing that you did to armor and crit items, that is, give each AD assassin item the same stat-line but maybe each item's unique effects desirable in different situations? Everybody bought Deadman's Plate until Sunfire and Randuin's were put on-par with it. Everybody bought Statikk Shiv until Phantom Dancer and Runaan's were put on-par with it and Rapid Firecannon was introduced.

So, for Ghostblade, Duskblade, and Maw, give them each _20 flat penetration_ (**unique named passive, no longer stacks**) and _roughly 65 AD_ (change as needed).

-Ghostblade would be for assassins that want to cast lots of spells and need help getting to their target (CDR + move speed + attack speed)
-Duskblade would be for assassins that can already get to a target, but maybe need some extra help sealing the deal (execute passive)
-Maw would be for assassins who still need to get the job done, but are having trouble surviving against their (likely) AP mid-lane counterpart (situational sustain + defense)

Obviously, not every item group needs to be 'uniquely equal', but I would certainly prefer my over changes over the current "AD assassins buy every super-gold-efficient AD items and deal arse-loads of damage".

Would really just love to see the active on Ghostblade go back to a more melee focused activation again. One of the biggest reasons to buy a Ghostblade (and Scimitar) was for the active movement speed to stick to your targets better. It made playing champions like Garen much more bearable. Now that ranged are making use of it so frequently, it's basically relegated some champions to never seeing play because of how mobile ranged champions have become with the constant move speed changing abilities (Sivir speed, Ashe kiting, Jhin passive) and dashes (Lucian, Ezreal) it would be nice to see SOME of that removed to keep them from basically being untouchable when played very well.
